SENT.plain: There are common findings between BehÃ§et's disease (BD) and celiac disease (CD); however, association in the same patient is a rarity
We relate the third case in the literature of this overlap in a 40-year-old woman with history of obstipation since her childhood
She also presented asymmetric polyarthralgia, loss of weight, anemia, oral recurrent aphthas (>3/year) and genital ulcerations, inflammatory lower back pain, bowel bleeding and abdominal colic
Afterwards, she presented episodes of erythema nodosum, superficial thrombophlebitis, pseudofolliculitis and aseptic meningitis, thus fulfilling criteria for BD
Due to persistence of the digestive complaints, a gastrointestinal endoscopy was performed
The biopsy showed chronic duodenitis with intraepithelial lymphocytosis, crypt hyperplasia, and villous atrophy
She fulfilled the diagnosis criteria for CD; a gluten-free diet was applied with clinical improvement
Ascertaining whether pathogenic mechanisms are common in these two conditions requires further investigation
